results.title: Myxomatosis
results.brief_description: Produced to demonstrate to wool growers the best method of spreading the virus disease, Myxomatosis, among rabbits. The film surveys the extensive damage to pastures due to rabbit infestation and shows how the pest may be eradicated by the disease, fatal to rabbits, but harmless to farm animals and human beings. Recommended methods of spreading the disease are demonstrated; infection of healthy animals by the swab and inoculation methods; exposure of infected animal to mosquitoes; the spread of disease among the rabbit population of a district.

results.title: Myths of nationalism
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Towards the end of the 19th century, there was, in Europe, a second wave of industrialisation with a more advanced technology. This considers each of the major powers within Europe in relation to this new technology, in the years leading up to the Great War of 1914-18.

results.title: Myths of Childhood. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Sarah Gibson, Anna Grieve and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In this provocative three-part series, the idea that children anr innocent is confronted, aks why we blame childhood for adult unhappiness and questions the ambitions of parents who strive to be perfect. Children and adults from Australia, the USA and the United Kingdom talk about their own experiences. Best selling authors including Penelope Leach, Thomas Moore, Martin Seligman and Marina Warner discuss changing ideas about childhood and the raising of children Part 3: Perfection; in the era of psychology, contemporary parents have assumed responsibility for the emotional well being, self esteem and happiness of their children. Is it possible to have a perfect childhood?

results.title: Myths of childhood. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Sarah Gibson, Anna Grieve and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In this provocative three-part series, the idea that children anr innocent is confronted, aks why we blame childhood for adult unhappiness and questions the ambitions of parents who strive to be perfect. Children and adults from Australia, the USA and the United Kingdom talk about their own experiences. Best selling authors including Penelope Leach, Thomas Moore, Martin Seligman and Marina Warner discuss changing ideas about childhood and the raising of children Part 2: Damage; today we search childhood memories for the causes of our adult discontent. “Damage done to us as children is blamed for everything from alcoholism to depression. But how important is childhood in the making of adult personality.

results.title: Myths and legends of ancient Greece
results.creator_credit: Warren Colman and Rainbow Educational Video
results.brief_description: The fantastic creatures and heroic adventures of Ancient Greek literature come to life as students view three of the most exciting tales handed down from the classical world. There are three stories in this program; Jason and the Golden Fleece, Daedalus and Icarus, and Pandora’s Box. Greek myths have been told for thousands of years and have survived the ages because they offer insight into human nature and lessons about morality and justice. Suitable for Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Mythical cats
results.creator_credit: Brian Cummings, Michael Waterhouse and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Cats have intrigued us for thousands of years: beautiful but brutal, affectionate yet natural born killers. The Egyptians worshipped the cat. The Pharoahs adopted the lion as the symbol of their power and majesty, building the huge Sphinx at Giza. Mythical Cats explores our complex relationship with these fascinating creatures, from the terrifying Griffin to beguiling eatern tales of tigers on the moon. Narrated by Zoe Wanamaker.

results.title: Mystical Rose
results.brief_description: A collage of animation and live action footage with complex symbolic images being offset by a careful balance of pop music and classical chants. It details the exploitation of the female psyche, the castration complex, fertility rites and the repressive nature of the Church. Lee’s approach is at times violent and iconoclastic, but what emerges from this savage attack on religious mythology is the awareness of nature’s eternal rejuvenation process. Rated: R

results.title: Mystical Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Michael Jewell, Christopher Zrike, Video Technics International and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Your visit to exotic Malaysia begins in the capital, Kuala Lumpur, one of the worlds most fascinating cities. Travel to the famed trading port of Malacca, with its Dutch architecture and gape as worshippers burn paper money in the Temple of Bright Clouds. Journey to Sarawak and ride a native longboat deep into the Borneo jungle.

results.title: Mystic river
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Judie G. Hoyt, Robert Lorenz and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: An intense drama from director Clint Eastwood, about three childhood friends whose paths meet in adult life when one of their teenage children is murdered. Sean Penn (Jimmy) plays the anguished father of the murdered girl (winning an Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance), with Kevin Bacon (Sean) as the police detective investigating, and Tim Robbins as the troubled suspect Dave (also an Academy Award winning performance). Based on the novel by Dennis Lehane. Cast also includes Marcia Gay Harden, Laurence Fishburne and Laura Linney.
